alert.note: Alert for Audrain; Montgomery; Pike; Ralls (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 3:21AM CDT until August 12 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Ralls County in northeastern Missouri... Northeastern Audrain County in central Missouri... Montgomery County in east central Missouri... Southwestern Pike County in northeastern Missouri... * Until 400 AM CDT. * At 320 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Perry to near Laddonia to near Shamrock to near Auxvasse, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At A measured wind gust of 61 mph was reported at 316 AM at the Mexico airport. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Vandalia, Montgomery City, Wellsville, New Florence, Jonesburg, Bellflower, Farber, Buell, New Hartford, Big Spring, Mineola, High Hill, Middletown, Rhineland, McKittrick, St. Clement, Danville, Americus, and Ashley. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 170 and 183. This also includes Graham Cave State Park. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
